comment.author: 43927621@N02
comment._content: where is this school? is near the Roxborough  garda station?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/43927621@N02] Afraid I don't know! Think the school is now known as Scoil an Spioraid Naomh, but "travelled" up and down Roxboro Road on Google Street View and couldn't find a similar building...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I think it may be this building on the OS 25", which is gone now. It was on the corner of Roxborough road and Roxborough Avenue, it was a school, and the plan view matches (what we can see, anyway). If so, the front door (with steps) would have been here

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I'm sure of this now: here it is in the Dictionary of Irish Architects - not much help with dates (completed 1838) but it was bought by the Mental Hospital committee 1932.St. Anne's day hospital is now built on this site.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Thanks Niall. Location amended, and hazarding circa 1890...
